turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hi, hi I'm <UNSURE>Maria</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello, I'm Doctor Jacob and welcome to Babylon.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: How are you doing?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm all right, thank you. Well I feel a little weird today, to be honest.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, so just before we <UNIN/> we start, is it all right if you could confirm your full name for me please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes. Maria <UNSURE>Trabalotsa</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, day and your date of birth?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: That is the first of October, ninety-nine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and your email address for me please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, M <UNSURE>Traba</UNSURE> at Gmail dot com.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and just to confirm that you're in a secure location and we <UNSURE>can</UNSURE> have a confidential conversation?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes I think I am, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Good, right, you've mentioned in <UNIN/> in, in your patient notes that you're having some <UNIN/> sort of lip swelling, and you after you had a sandwich. Is that correct?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah that is, well, I don't think, I don't think it was, it it wasn't a sandwich but it was, it was something with prawn so.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Basically, I, I sometimes go with my friends to, to this place called <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And, we, we regularly have like usually I have like a normal vegetarian soup <UNSURE>or</UNSURE> something.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Mm-hmm</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And yeah, and, then I wanted to try something new.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so what happened was, I, I ordered a prawn soup <UNSURE>it it's it it's</UNSURE> called <UNIN/> <UNSURE>it's like</UNSURE> a soup, I ordered a prawn one this time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And, yeah and then my <UNSURE>feel</UNSURE> <UNIN/> like my lips started feeling a little weird just in <UNSURE>the</UNSURE> in the corner sort of on the left first.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And then, I don't know and then, we went back we had little bit of chat, of banter I wasn't really, paying attention.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Uh</UNSURE>, now I feel the that there is a swelling, there is like a swelling on my, on my upper lip and it's kind of getting bigger. I don't know what to do.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Right</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. So when did you have the prawn soup? What time?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: That was, that must have been just after work, so maybe like around seven.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, around seven o'clock, and um how long did it take to develop the swelling?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Well I wasn't really paying attention so, it must have been like, must have been like, I don't know half an hour maybe.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK in half an hour you developed the swelling yeah?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and it's getting bigger and bigger?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah <UNSURE>it's it it</UNSURE> <UNIN/> still feel it like, really pumping blood and it's kinda getting bigger it feels like it's getting worse.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> OK. So, just a few more questions. Um, so you mentioned about <UNSURE>your</UNSURE> swelling of your lips. Is there any feeling of swelling in in your throat, like your throat is closing up, any feeling like that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah actually, I, I feel like I can't breathe that well right now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And do you feel like, like your chest is tight?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And I don't know <UNSURE>if it's the</UNSURE> chest it just generally feels a little difficult, but yeah it might be, I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And just a few <UNIN/> have you ever these <UNIN/> any kind of lip swelling in the past? After eating any food?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, well, maybe, I remember like a year ago.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: A year ago I was, out with my friends.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And I think we went like, to a late night kinda Chinese place, and I remember that I was quite drunk to be honest.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And I remember that after like having that very late.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>I've</UNSURE> woke up the next morning quite swollen up and had also I, felt really bad and <UNSURE>quite</UNSURE> difficult breathing, but I <UNSURE>don't</UNSURE> know what it was I had it was like a curry or something I think.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Uh, and what did you take at that time? Did you use anything like antihistamine or anything, when you had that last time?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: But I generally have asthma so, I <UNSURE>took</UNSURE> I, I take, ohh what's it called? Salbutamol inhalers?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, so I do take that regularly but I've always taken it. I generally have <UNSURE>asthma</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And any other inhalers? Is it just the Salbutamol that you use? Any other brown inhalers?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh I, no I don't think so, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> OK right and um so, do you use antihistamines like <UNIN/> Cetirizine, Loratadine, Piriton, any of those, kind of things?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hmm, no. I, I <UNSURE>got</UNSURE> no I <UNSURE>do</UNSURE> sometimes but I don't know which ones, but I have a peanut allergy as well, like always had it.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I, think I do get antihistamines for that but I'm not sure which ones.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And any <UNIN/> point because you had peanut allergy, any time you <UNSURE>have</UNSURE> to ever use like an injection?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: When I was a kid I think I remember my mom told me about it, but I don't know what it was 'cause I was small and I've changed doctors since.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, so has your mum ever said that you had to go to hospital because you had an severe allergic reaction?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah <UNSURE>is that well</UNSURE> I was like six <UNSURE>or</UNSURE> something I, I, I think. Ohh sorry, the swelling is getting, ohh my god ohh, yeah I think when I was <UNSURE>six</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>You all right</UNSURE>? Are you OK now?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh, I feel a <UNSURE>little</UNSURE> dizzy right now to be honest, ohh.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Are you</UNSURE> <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You're <UNSURE>feeling</UNSURE> dizzy. OK, right do you have any kind of, uh, antihistamines with you at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> No, I don't think I have no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>, right OK, so.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, uh, all right I, I'm really a bit worried about you at the moment, Maria. <UNIN/> Um I think we need to call an ambulance, because, um, from what history you've been telling me. It sounds like you could be going into what we say an a, an anaphylactic reaction. That's when your throat and your chest, you know closes in and you might need an injection like what your mum's.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, you know what your mum told you as you were a young child. O<UNSURE>K, all</UNSURE> right so is there any, anyone with you at the moment or are you alone?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm alone at the moment, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Ohh no</UNSURE> so hang on the line, while I'll call the ambulance OK, and I'll send them right to you, OK and <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Hey ohh</UNSURE> somebody just came, somebody just came yes, I'm not alone any more. <UNSURE>Thank</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right, OK somebody just came. So just call the <UNIN/> ambulance make sure that person's with you till the ambulance comes, yeah. Uh and <UNIN/> because we are worried about an anaphylactic reaction so you need go straight away. Could you ask the person whether they have any antihistamines around, in the interim, while we're waiting.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, uh Mum, Mum do we have any antihistamines around? Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yes <UNSURE>K</UNSURE>. Do that straight away and if mum can call. Mum, if you can call the <UNIN/> uh nine nine <UNIN/>, nine nine nine yeah, and say that your there is a suspected anaphylactic reaction and they need to come straight away. OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh <UNSURE>yeah</UNSURE> yeah we do <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes she said she will yes, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>All right</UNSURE>, so straight away take the antihistamines in the meantime all right.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, OK. Yes, thank <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>And</UNSURE> <UNIN/> <UNSURE>after</UNSURE> you come out from the hospital <UNIN/> do give us a ring back we might need to sort you out, um, with your injections and things like that OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, yes will do, yes, thank <UNIN/> .

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK then, take care.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Thank you very much thank <UNSURE>bye</UNSURE> bye.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Bye <UNSURE>bye</UNSURE>, bye. <UNIN/>
